newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU farm officials split on cereals area penalties.
newsitem.headline: EU farm officials split on cereals area penalties.

text.p: European Union farm experts remain split over plans to change the rules for exceeding base areas for planting cereals, an EU official said on Wednesday.
"The special agriculture committee failed to resolve the differences over this despite a long discussion on Tuesday," the official said.
Germany has proposed that the present regulation should be amended to allow penalties for overshooting of base areas to be applied to those regions or states responsible.
"The German Laender (states) want the change because not all have been responsible for the national overshoot in the past," the official added.
The penalty for exceeding permitted base areas is a one percent cut in the following season for every one percent of overplanting.
But other member states, notably France, Italy, Portugal and Ireland, presented what the official described as "a shopping list of demands aimed at letting their farmers escape penalties."
